content: Not sure if this is the right place to ask :smile: But wondered if the rust-lang org had been invited to participate in the GitHub Discussions beta (or is it by repo rather than org)? We'd be keen to give it a go in rust-lang/api-guidelines
I think we can make that happen for you
That would be fantastic thanks! Have we used discussions elsewhere in the org? I’m curious whether things like FCPs would Just Work, or whether we’d need to update rfcbot
I imagine that the majority of our tooling would not work. We have not used them elsewhere to my knowledge.
yes, I would not expect our tooling to work
@Ashley Mannix also gave the full libs team maintain access
so hopefully y'all should be able to configure the discussions
AFAICT there’s still no public API for Discussions.
Thanks @Pietro Albini! :bow:

Ah that's a bit of a shame about no public API. But I imagine it'll be similar enough to issues and PRs that we'll be able to get our tools working with them when we can. Running FCPs on discussions would be interesting to try when we can
Yeah, usually it's not too fast. We'll see.
We could do them manually for now anyways :smile:
